servinfo.title: DTC Clearance
servinfo.ptxt: Automatic transmission DTC can be cleared using any one of the following 2 methods.

attention3.ptxt: DTC and freeze frame data stored in TCM memory are also cleared in following cases. Be careful not to clear them before keeping their record.

item.ptxt: When power to TCM is cut off (by disconnecting battery cable, removing fuse or disconnecting TCM connector).
When the same malfunction (DTC) is not detected again during 40 engine warm-up cycles.

servinfosub.title: DTC Clearance Using SUZUKI Scan Tool

s1.ptxt: Connect SUZUKI scan tool to data link connector (DLC) (1).
Clear DTC according to instructions displayed on SUZUKI scan tool. Refer to SUZUKI scan tool operator’s manual for further details.
After completing the clearance, turn ignition switch OFF and disconnected SUZUKI scan tool from data link connector (DLC).

servinfosub.title: DTC Clearance Using Monitor Connector (If Equipped)

s1.ptxt: After 6 seconds or more, repeat connecting and disconnecting diagnosis switch terminal (3) of monitor connector (2) and body ground 5 times at about 1 second interval within 10 seconds, using service wire.
Check TCM that no malfunction DTC remains in memory of it.
